content.description: Climb the center of the face using sidepulls and crimps. Make a committing move to top out.
content.location: It is 0.4 miles into Arthur's Rock trail and 10 minutes from the parking lot.

content.description: From the NoCoClimbing.org guide: "stand start on nice opposing holds, and do a move or two of compression before reaching the obvious slopey shelf. Mantel this, and call it a day."
content.location:
This is just to the left of

Corner Crack

.

content.description: This is a fun, easy warm-up on your way to the main bouldering trail.  There are great flakes to grab onto, with the topout being a bit awkward.
content.protection: A pad will suffice, though you'll probably flash it.
content.location:
"To reach the Parking Lot Wall, walk west on the Arthurs Rock Trail. The wall is about 5 minutes from the parking lot on the right."

- from the NoCo guide for Arthur's Rock

It's pretty hard to miss the area, there's the

Corner Crack

that is pretty unmistakeable that I always use as a landmark, which is about 20 feet to the left of this problem.

content.description: From the NoCoClimbing.org guide: "start on an obvious incut edge, and move up and right following good edges to the lip." It is a fun, short problem.
content.location:
This is just to the right of

Easy Flake

.

content.description: This is such a perfect finger crack in the corner.  It is another great warmup before you get to the main bouldering trail.  Don't expect any feet, it's smear city all the way up. Just layback, walk on up, and bask in the beauty of this route.
content.protection: A pad, and spotter would be nice, 'cause it's kinda tall.
content.location:
"To reach the Parking Lot Wall, walk west on the Arthurs Rock Trail. The wall is about 5 minutes from the parking lot on the right."

- from the NoCo guide for Arthur's Rock

It's pretty hard to miss the area, this is about 20 feet to the left if you are looking at the

Easy Flake

.
